title: The Bridge
occurrences: Coming to the bridge after school? They say that's where the bomb was.
I'm going to the bridge.
Only the wooden bridge.
- There's that little bridge... - That's not important.
But the bridge must be defended! Those kids could do that!
The bridge isn't important. It will be blown up.
- But that's our bridge! - What have we got to do here?
The bridge must be blown up at the right time. Understand?
We know this bridge - and its strategic position.
You go on the bridge and stand guard.
Defending the bridge.
Don't talk nonsense. The bridge is going to be blown up.
My group's at the bridge. I can't leave them.
You fools, don't be so stubborn. Come to the bridge and see for yourself!
We've been ordered to defend this bridge.
We must defend this bridge!
Why do you idiots have to stop in the middle of a bridge?
We're soldiers! We have orders to hold the bridge!
This little bridge can't win the war!
We'll let them through and then blow the bridge up.
Playing about on the bridge instead of letting the Americans through.
Get off the bridge.
